# Unfogged Documentation Hub

Welcome to the Unfogged AI assistant documentation. This folder contains all guidelines and context for AI-assisted development.

## Documentation Structure

### Main Entry Point
- **[copilot-instructions.md](./copilot-instructions.md)**  
  Start here. Overview of your role, quick reference, and links to detailed docs.

### Core Documentation
1. **[instructions/project.instructions.md](./instructions/project.instructions.md)**  
   - Project vision and goals
   - Technical architecture
   - Fog system design
   - Development priorities

2. **[instructions/coding.instructions.md](./instructions/coding.instructions.md)**  
   - TypeScript style guide
   - React best practices
   - Tailwind CSS guidelines
   - Code organization rules

3. **[AI_AGENT_SUPPORT.md](./AI_AGENT_SUPPORT.md)**  
   - Implementation status (done, pending)
   - Detailed technical roadmap
   - Next steps and priorities

## Quick Start for AI Assistants

1. Read **[copilot-instructions.md](./copilot-instructions.md)** for overview
2. Review **[project.instructions.md](./instructions/project.instructions.md)** for context
3. Check **[coding.instructions.md](./instructions/coding.instructions.md)** before coding
4. Consult **[AI_AGENT_SUPPORT.md](./AI_AGENT_SUPPORT.md)** for current status

> **Not sure which doc to read?** Check **[DECISION_TREE.md](./DECISION_TREE.md)**

## Key Principles

- **Offline-first**: All features work without network
- **Mobile-first**: Touch-optimized, performant PWA
- **Type-safe**: Strong TypeScript everywhere
- **Clean code**: Readable, maintainable, well-structured
- **Performance**: 60fps on mobile, fast startup

## External Resources

- [React Docs](https://react.dev/)
- [TypeScript Handbook](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/)
- [Tailwind CSS](https://tailwindcss.com/docs)
- [Leaflet Documentation](https://leafletjs.com/)
- [React-Leaflet](https://react-leaflet.js.org/)

## Document Maintenance

When updating these docs:
- Keep examples realistic and consistent with codebase
- Update links when files move
- Maintain cross-references between documents
- Date significant changes in commit messages
